```{.r .cell-code}
# Load necessary Libraries
library(tidyverse)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dagitty)
library(ggdag)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'ggdag'
#> 
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     filter
```
:::
:::


1. DAG for Parking Spots

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_338ecc1362326f9f00eec28c1eee4c07'}

```{.r .cell-code}
Parkingspots <- dagify(
  ParkingSpots ~ Location,
  Sales ~ Location,
  Sales ~ ParkingSpots,
  coords = list(x = c(Sales = 3, Location = 2, ParkingSpots = 1),
                y = c(Sales = 0, Location = 1, ParkingSpots = 0))
)
# Plot DAG
ggdag(Parkingspots, use_labels = "name", text =  F) + theme_dag()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


When the store is located within the city, no parking spots are required because customers approach the store directly and do not need to arrange their visit. As a result, the sales depend on the location. However when the store is located outside of the city, parking spots are required which I believe has a direct impact on sales.

2. Regression

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_ab712afe51233342e45f75b90c40e38c'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load the file
car_prices <- readRDS("Causal_Data_Science_Data/customer_sat.rds")
# Create a Data Frame
df1=data.frame(car_prices)
```
:::


2.1 Regress satisfaction on follow_ups 

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_66f579466dad78110503634836fd5150'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#lm_sf is the regresssion of satisfaction on follow_ups
lm_sf <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups , data = df1)
summary(lm_sf)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = df1)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -12.412  -5.257   1.733   4.506  12.588 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)  78.8860     4.2717  18.467 1.04e-10 ***
#> follow_ups   -3.3093     0.6618  -5.001 0.000243 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.658,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6316 
#> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF,  p-value: 0.0002427
```
:::
:::


2.2 Regress satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_ae90661112c117fa9139bdc2709c6b57'}

```{.r .cell-code}
#lm_sfa is the regresssion of satisfaction on follow_ups and account for subscription
lm_sfa <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription , data = df1)
summary(lm_sfa)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = df1)
#> 
#> Residuals:
#>     Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
#> -4.3222 -2.1972  0.3167  2.2667  3.9944 
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#>                      Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
#> (Intercept)           26.7667     6.6804   4.007  0.00206 ** 
#> follow_ups             2.1944     0.7795   2.815  0.01682 *  
#> subscriptionPremium   44.7222     5.6213   7.956 6.88e-06 ***
#> subscriptionPremium+  18.0722     2.1659   8.344 4.37e-06 ***
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
#> 
#> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom
#> Multiple R-squared:  0.9597,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9487 
#> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF,  p-value: 5.956e-08
```
:::
:::



3. Comparing the coefficients: 

In the first case, satisfaction on follow_ups are negatively correlated which suggests that the increase in satisfaction with the product and service will decrease the follow_up calls to the clients.

In the second case, satisfaction on follow_ups which accounts for subscription is highly correlated premium subscription levels than elite subscription levels.

4 Plot the data

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_312ce92f82e49db79058697f496a6556'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Not conditioning on subscription
subscription_not_cond <- ggplot(df1, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups)) +
  geom_point(alpha = .8) +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)

# Conditioning on subscription 
subscription_cond <- ggplot(df1, aes(x = satisfaction, y = follow_ups, color = subscription)) +
  geom_point(alpha = .8) +
  stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) +
  theme(legend.position = "right")

# Plot both plots
subscription_not_cond
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
subscription_cond
```

